instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1706: What is A1706? A1706 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3071, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00239, 820-00923..
definitions.820-00923: What is 820-00923? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
Hi, 
I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A, that had liquid contact (can't see any signs of it, but client says that has droped a few drops of water on the keyboard).
The laptop powers on, but can see the SSD, and the touch bar doesn't work.
I get 0V on <SIGNAL>PPVIN_2V7NAND_LB</SIGNAL>, and i assume that it is because of that the ssd doesn't work. I've checked the test point near <RESISTOR>R9350</RESISTOR>, but everithing looks ok in that area (actualy i can't see no signs of corrosion anywhere , except a bit in the BL <CAPACITOR>C8500</CAPACITOR>).

Where should i start? Can you help?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
Touchbar doesn't work because needs to load its firmware from SSD.
So you should to fix SSD issue, if possible.

"I get 0V on <SIGNAL>PPVIN_2V7NAND_LB</SIGNAL>"
Bad contact on J9600?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
Hi, it was a bit of dirt on  J9600.  After cleaning with IPA it started to work again.
Thanks!
